description: Numbers whose set of base 8 digits is {0,1}.
comments: Sums of distinct powers of 8.Every nonnegative n is a unique sum of the form a(p)+2a(q)+4a(r). This gives a one-to-one map of the set N_0 of all nonnegative integers to (N_0)^3. Furthermore, if, for a fixed positive integer m, to consider all sums of distinct powers of 2^m, then one can obtain a one-to-one map of the set N_0 to (N_0)^m. [From _Vladimir Shevelev_, Nov 15 2008]
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..1023
formula: a(n)=Sum{d(i)*8^i: i=0, 1, ..., m}, where Sum{d(i)*2^i: i=0, 1, ..., m} is the base 2 representation of n.a(n) = A097254(n)/7.a(2n) = 8*a(n), a(2n+1) = a(2n)+1.a(n)=Sum_k>=0 {A030308(n,k)*8^k}. - From _Philippe Del√©ham_, Oct 19 2011.
author: _Clark Kimberling_
extensions: More terms from _Patrick De Geest_, Dec 23 2000
